WorkItem.Description:
Hi all,
 
I've got a strange problem. I have a report generated from PHPExcel. When I open it in Excel or OpenOffice everthing is fine.
Under iOS 4.3 (iPad) I have numbers missing. I had setPreCalculateFormulas to true, because setting it to false made it worse.
 
I attached an iamge which shows the same column. First one is the column from Excel 2007 the second one from the iPad.
 
I've got not a clue how to debug this issue - what could be wrong? Does anyone has the same problem?
WorkItem.Summary: Wrong data displayed under iOS's iPad

Comments.Message: Is this using Apple Numbers on the iPad?

@MarkBaker I am not sure about that - but I would guess that they use a diffrent libary to open excle files because on a iDevice you are just able to view the data and not alter it. 

If I open the file under Excle 2007 and save it again (save as) the numbers are shown on the iPad are correct.

Hi All,

I found why the numbers are wrong. OpenOffice or MS Excel handling empty fields as zero (0) but iOS Excel doesn't. So every calculation has to fail.
Workaround: Fill empty fields with a zero :)
